column1: #Text=Polycrystalline ingots of Mn1.4Pt1−xPdxSn (x = 0,\r0.1…0.3) and Mn1.4Pt1−yRhySn (y = 0.1, 0.2…0.8) with\rthe stoichiometric amounts of constituent elements were\rprepared by arc melting in the presence of Ar atmosphere.

#Text=The synthesized ingots were sealed in an evacuated quartz\rtube and annealed at 873 K (Pd-substituted samples) and\r1073 K (parent compound Mn1.4PtSn and Rh-substituted\rsamples) for 7 d followed by quenching into an ice-water\rmixture.

#Text=The phase purity and the crystal structure of the\rsamples were examined by room-temperature powder x-ray\rdiffraction using a Huber G670 camera [Guinier technique,\rλ = 1.540 56Å (Cu − Kα1 radiation)].
